item.title: Fight For Your Right to Broadband
item.description:
Are you frustrated with slow internet speeds that interrupt your work and entertainment? You’re not alone. Despite being a global leader, the United States lags behind in internet access, ranking 16th globally in broadband subscriptions per capita. While South Korea boasts 24.9 subscriptions per 100 people, the US has only 11.4. Furthermore, South Korea enjoys speeds of 45.50 Mbps, while Japan leads with 61 Mbps. In contrast, the US averages a mere 1...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fight-for-your-right-to-broadband/

item.title: Philly Stake With WiFi...Mmm
item.description:
Philadelphia’s most exciting new venture is citywide WiFi, generating significant buzz after Earthlink abandoned a similar project. This isn’t a completely new endeavor, but rather a revival of the existing infrastructure under new management, a group of local investors confident in their ability to succeed. Their strategy is based on free access for consumers, a welcome change from the $20 monthly fee for the previous unreliable service. Although a discounted plan was offered, even a reduced cost can be prohibitive for low-income residents...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/philly-stake-with-wifimmm/
